1.text: Doesn’t wisdom cry out? Doesn’t understanding raise her voice?

2.text: On the top of high places by the way, where the paths meet, she stands.

3.text: Beside the gates, at the entry of the city, at the entry doors, she cries aloud:

4.text: “To you men, I call! I send my voice to the sons of mankind.

5.text: You simple, understand prudence. You fools, be of an understanding heart.

6.text: Hear, for I will speak excellent things. The opening of my lips is for right things.

7.text: For my mouth speaks truth. Wickedness is an abomination to my lips.

8.text: All the words of my mouth are in righteousness. There is nothing crooked or perverse in them.

9.text: They are all plain to him who understands, right to those who find knowledge.

10.text: Receive my instruction rather than silver; knowledge rather than choice gold.

11.text: For wisdom is better than rubies. All the things that may be desired can’t be compared to it.

12.text: “I, wisdom, have made prudence my dwelling. Find out knowledge and discretion.

13.text: The fear of Yahweh is to hate evil. I hate pride, arrogance, the evil way, and the perverse mouth.

14.text: Counsel and sound knowledge are mine. I have understanding and power.

15.text: By me kings reign, and princes decree justice.

16.text: By me princes rule; nobles, and all the righteous rulers of the earth.

17.text: I love those who love me. Those who seek me diligently will find me.

18.text: With me are riches, honor, enduring wealth, and prosperity.

19.text: My fruit is better than gold, yes, than fine gold; my yield than choice silver.

20.text: I walk in the way of righteousness, in the midst of the paths of justice;

21.text: That I may give wealth to those who love me. I fill their treasuries.

22.text: “Yahweh possessed me in the beginning of his work, before his deeds of old.

23.text: I was set up from everlasting, from the beginning, before the earth existed.

24.text: When there were no depths, I was brought forth, when there were no springs abounding with water.

25.text: Before the mountains were settled in place, before the hills, I was brought forth;

26.text: while as yet he had not made the earth, nor the fields, nor the beginning of the dust of the world.

27.text: When he established the heavens, I was there; when he set a circle on the surface of the deep,

28.text: when he established the clouds above, when the springs of the deep became strong,

29.text: when he gave to the sea its boundary, that the waters should not violate his commandment, when he marked out the foundations of the earth;

30.text: then I was the craftsman by his side. I was a delight day by day, always rejoicing before him,

31.text: Rejoicing in his whole world. My delight was with the sons of men.

32.text: “Now therefore, my sons, listen to me, for blessed are those who keep my ways.

33.text: Hear instruction, and be wise. Don’t refuse it.

34.text: Blessed is the man who hears me, watching daily at my gates, waiting at my door posts.

35.text: For whoever finds me, finds life, and will obtain favor from Yahweh.

36.text: But he who sins against me wrongs his own soul. All those who hate me love death.”
